page.title: 11 Fruit Farming (3)
page.content: The yearly round of farming tasks was described to us by the farm manager as follows: In the winter the pruning and applying of herbicides takes place and the clearing and shredding of prunings.Fertiliser has to be applied in spinner pellet form.Spraying takes place every 10 days from the end of March to August.Air blast machines are used for this.Young trees have straw and dung put round the base of the trunk.This is called mulching.Some summer pruning is carried out.Branches are tied down to encourage outward growth.Fruit thinning takes place in early summer.Warm weather is hoped for in spring,not the cold dry winds of 1985's spring.Finally harvesting takes place; all, of course, carried out by hand.
